ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Got better at sightreading. learned about renaissance music
I learned how to play the viola da gamba
I strengthened my ensemble skills while also exploring new repertoire.
Early music singing techniques
I learned about Italian Renaissance music/ pronunciation and history!
How to authentically sing in Italian! Learned more about the historical context of renaissance and baroque Italian music
I learned how to play one of the coolest instruments ever, the viol!
I learned a great deal about early music performance practices.
I learned new early music repertoire, sight reading skills, and how to pronounce things in Italian!!
I learned about viol technique and Italian Renaissance music.
I learned early music percussion techniques and more about the history of music during the Renaissance period.
Early music knowledge

I learned about early Italian music from the renaissance. I learned about performance practice, musical styles, and facts about how early music is studied and preserved. I also learned a bunch of songs.
Performance practice of renaissance and baroque music, working with a large early music ensemble, and performing on period instruments.
I learned a lot about renaissance music, compositional techniques, and performance practices. I also got better at sight reading.
You sing early music
Got to play the harpsichord and practiced accompanying the ensemble
I learned more about early music, sight singing, listening, and other technical skills. I also learned about techniques and history I did not know before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not sure how I was doing throughout the whole course.
Very fun course
I really enjoyed everything about this course.
Super chill, really fun to be in with friends

Strengths: the course was very flexible, engaging, and the final presentation was very fun!

Weakness: no feedback throughout semester
Top tier class

This class is unlike any other. Grant is truly so knowledgeable about this time period in music and it is such a pleasure to hear him speak, sing, and play to this music. He is like the renaissance man of Yale music. The strength is definitely Grant's expertise, and the camaraderie developed in the class by performing together. It's such a supportive environment.
This course is precisely what it as marketed as. It was an extremely fun experience that resembled a choir class.
This course is amazing for any musician wishing to engage more! Approachable for any level of singer

This is a fantastic course! It is so much fun to perform in an early music ensemble with friends and classmates. I learned a lot about Renaissance music and the techniques necessary to perform it. The style of this music is so different from traditional classical music, so it was great to be exposed to it and understand its structure. Learning a Renaissance instrument is a fun yet challenging adventure, but the reward of performing at the Beinecke was incredible!
No weaknesses, the strengths are that the teacher is amazing and that the class is structured in a way that lends itself to rehearsal and music making.
Incredible class. One of my favorite classes Ive taken at Yale

Group rehearsals were very productive. Breakout sections with voice parts were a bit difficult to manage without an appointed section leader, but were infrequent enough that it didn't pose a significant challenge.

Strengths:
- Professor Herreid is a true expert on early music and an exceptional musician. He is also extremely charming and fun to work with.
- Relatively high level of students. The class had members of the YSO, on-campus vocal groups, and graduate music school.
- The opportunity to play in a large early music ensemble is very rare and I'm grateful that Yale provides it.

Weaknesses:
- The theory component of the class was really interesting, but I wish the content was covered in more detail.
No weaknesses, it's a great class and very chill.
Only strengths. Truly a cornerstone of my Yale music education

This course really helped me learn musical skills through hands on work. It could be a little more structured/organized during class time and when we are doing sectionals or music should be learned by.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You gotta
yes so fun! Prof herreid is great and so is this class!!!!
Yes
Yes, this is a great way to enjoy and perform new repertoire.
Yes! Such a fun class for singers and instrumentalists.
Yes!!!
Yep! Great music course!
Absolutely

I would wholeheartedly recommend this course to any serious musician. Don't take this class if you don't know how to read music, obviously, but it's such a rewarding experience for a very wide range of instrumentalists and singers.
Yes! Best class ever!
I had so much fun singing in this class! Take it!
Yes! This is one of the best courses at Yale, and the opportunity to perform and learn Renaissance music (particularly for instrumentalists) is one you might not get elsewhere.
I would recommend this course to someone who can play an instrument and enjoys playing it.
Yes, especially those interested in the performance of early music.
Yes, very interesting lectures and fun music. Grant is also super cool.
Absolutely. For anyone even mildly interested in performing early music, this course is a no-brainer.

I can only speak to the experience of taking the class as a singer, but I definitely recommend it. It's fun, Prof Herreid is a great professor, and it's not a lot of work. If you can't sight read very well you'll need to spend some extra time practicing, but even then I'd recommend the class.
If you can hold a tune and/or do a cappella, great stress free class to add to your course schedule.
Yes! You can have the chance to play a new instrument and play early music with an ensemble (and perform in the Beinecke!) in a low-stakes setting.
Yes, this class is fantastic, the music will challenge you and you will have a wonderful experience.
Yes if you are interested in the material! Performing in the Beinecke was such an incredible experience, as well as learning new music and performing with unique instruments.

extras.title: MUSI 240 01 - The Performance of Early Music
